title: Olivia Buckland and Alex Bowen 'rejected from TOWIE' after auditioning
text:

Olivia Buckland, 25, and Alex Bowen, 27, were 'rejected from TOWIE' after they told they show producers the don't 'argue' or like 'drama.'

The newlyweds - who now have their own reality show Olivia & Alex: Happily Ever After on TLC - shared they are fans of the show but they did not see how they would fit in when they discussed joining The Only Way Is Essex cast with the show makers.

The smitten couple reflected on the meeting during an appearance on The Reality Tea podcast after being quizzed if they would be open to appearing on the Essex based reality TV series.

Olivia shared: "TOWIE is a bit savage for me, I’d be a bit too scared. I love watching it.”

Before she asked Alex: “Didn’t we audition to be on it once?”

(Image: Emma Smith)

The hunk clarified: “It wasn’t really an audition, it was just to come down and see where you could fit into the story lines and, I think I even said: ‘I don’t know how I can fit in with this accent’ I’m not from Essex so. I think it was a really confusing time when we went to go in there, really. I was like, ‘What we getting asked to go on here for?’”

Olivia told: “We said: ‘No, we don’t like drama, we don’t really argue, we’re just quite fun…’”

Alex then dished: “They were just like: ‘No’.”

(Image: PA)

Olivia continued: “We got rejected from TOWIE! But, I don’t mind that, I love watching it, but it is a bit much for us. You can see from our show we’re more about the fun-filled, silly weird vibes!”

It comes after the couple opened up about the fierce competition between their Love Island co-stars.

Three years after they shot to fame in the villa the pair have admitted they don't envy the 2019 stars in the current climate.

"It is so competitive now," Olivia told The Mirror.

"They know that there are deals out there to be had. It automatically feels like you should get one if you're the winner or if you come second or whatever.

(Image: Instagram)

(Image: Getty)

"Competition is natural because this is the industry," added Olivia. "You just have to carry on trying to stick to your path."

Alex agreed, "We didn't really know what were were going to get when we came out, I reckon there's a few [contestants] this year that will be a lasting success.

"When you come outside that's the real test. People have different career paths and [relationships] can come under strain," he added.

"I think a lot of them will do really well," Olivia agreed. "Its mad we're still going this far on. We never thought we'd get our own TV show three years after Love Island happened.

"We're really grateful. It will never sink in."
description: The husband and wife have lifted the lid on how they met show producers to discuss joining the cast of the ITVbe show
